nodes.Label: Aaron
nodes.Name: Aaron
nodes.Blurb: Aaron was one of Mosiah's sons. After being converted to the gospel, he and his brothers went on a several-year mission to the Lamanites.
nodes.Docs: Alma, Alma the Younger,  Amalekite, Ammon Son of Mosiah, Angel,  Anti-Nephi-Lehi,  Chief Judge,  Father of Lamoni,  Godhead,  Mosiah

nodes.Label: Abinadi
nodes.Name: Abinadi
nodes.Blurb: Abinadi was a prophet who was killed by King Noah after calling his people to repentance. Although Abinadi saw no success from his preaching in his lifetime, one of King Noah's priests, Alma, was converted and became a force for good.
nodes.Docs: Alma, Godhead, King Noah, Priests of Noah

nodes.Label: Abraham
nodes.Name: Abraham
nodes.Blurb: Abraham covenanted with God to become the father of many nations in the Old Testament.

nodes.Label: Adam
nodes.Name: Adam
nodes.Blurb: Adam was the first man and progenitor of mankind.

nodes.Label: Aha
nodes.Name: Aha
nodes.Blurb: Aha was the son of Zoram, the chief captain of the Nephites, and a Nephite military leader.

nodes.Label: Ahaz
nodes.Name: Ahaz
nodes.Blurb: Ahaz was a wicked Old World king who lived at the time of Isaiah.

nodes.Label: Akish
nodes.Name: Akish
nodes.Blurb: Akish, a Jaredite, formed a secret combination to kill the king and take his throne.

nodes.Label: Alma
nodes.Name: Alma
nodes.Blurb: Alma was one of the wicked priests of king Noah. After hearing Abinadi speak, Alma's heart was changed and he was cast out by the king. He set about preaching Abinadi's words in private and baptized many at the waters of Mormon. He and his people eventually travelled to the land of Zarahemla, joining the people there. Alma served as high priest of the Church while Mosiah was king.
nodes.Docs: Aaron,  Ammon, Godhead, Helam, Himni, King Noah,  Mosiah,  Omner

nodes.Label: Alma the Younger
nodes.Name: Alma2
nodes.Blurb: Alma the Younger grew up with the sons of Mosiah. As a young man, he went about seeking to destroy the Church. As a result of the prayers of his father and others, Alma was visited by an angel and converted. Alma the Younger served as chief judge of the land and high priest over the Church.
nodes.Docs: Aaron,  Aha,  Ammon,  Amulek,  Angel,  Antionah,  Chief Judge in Ammonihah,  Corianton, Godhead, Helaman,  Himni,  Korihor,  Lehi Son of Zoram,  Mosiah,  Nehor,  Omner,  Shiblon,  Zeezrom,  Zoram Captain of Nephites

nodes.Label: Amalekite
nodes.Name: Amalekite
nodes.Blurb: An unnamed Amalekite briefly contended with Aaron about points of doctrine.

nodes.Label: Amalickiah
nodes.Name: Amalickiah
nodes.Blurb: After dissenting from the Nephites, Amalickiah used trickery to kill the Lamanite king and take the throne. He then led the Lamanites to battle against the Nephites, his former people.

nodes.Label: Ammaron
nodes.Name: Ammaron
nodes.Blurb: Ammaron saw that Mormon was an observant child and chose him as his successor as keeper of the plates.

nodes.Label: Ammon Son of Mosiah
nodes.Name: Ammon
nodes.Blurb: Ammon was one of the sons of Mosiah. He was so dedicated to preaching the Gospel that he rejected his right to be king in order to lead a fourteen-year mission to the Lamanites. He served the Lamanite king Lamoni, and in one of the most memorable stories from the Book of Mormon, defended the king's sheep from bandit raiders.
nodes.Docs: Aaron,  Alma,  Alma the Younger,  Angel,  Anti-Nephi-Lehi,  Chief Judge,  Father of Lamoni,  Godhead, Himni,  Lamoni,  Mosiah,  Omner,  Servant of Lamoni,  Servants of Lamoni,  Wife of Lamoni

nodes.Label: Ammon the Mulekite
nodes.Name: Ammon2
nodes.Blurb: Ammon, a Mulekite, was a mighty man and a descendant of Zarahemla. On an expedition, he found the people of Limhi.

nodes.Label: Ammoron
nodes.Name: Ammoron
nodes.Blurb: Ammoron was Amalickiah's brother and a dissenter from the Nephites. After Amalickiah was slain in battle, Ammoron led the Lamanite forces to attack the Nephites.

nodes.Label: Amulek
nodes.Name: Amulek
nodes.Blurb: Amulek was a rich and popular Nephite living in the city of Ammonihah when an angel commanded him in a vision to receive Alma the Younger into his home. Alma helped Amulek grow strong in the faith, and they served together as missionary companions. Although their mission was full of hardship, miracles followed them, and they were ultimately successful.
nodes.Docs: Alma the Younger, Angel, Chief Judge in Ammonihah, Zeezrom

nodes.Label: Angel
nodes.Name: Angels
nodes.Blurb: Angels are celestial visitors that appear in the Book of Mormon to give counsel, and to guide prophets through visions.
nodes.Docs: Aaron, Alma the Younger,  Ammon Son of Mosiah, Amulek,  Benjamin,  Brothers of Nephi,  Himni,  Jacob,  Lehi,  Nephi,  Omner,  Samuel the Lamanite

nodes.Label: Anti-Nephi-Lehi
nodes.Name: AntiNephiLehi
nodes.Blurb: Anti-Nephi-Lehi was the leader of a group of Lamanites who were converted to the Lord. As part of their conversion, they buried their weapons as a symbol of their covenant to shed no more blood. Two thousand of their young men, who had not made the covenant, were led by Helaman to miraculous victories.
nodes.Docs: Aaron,  Ammon Son of Mosiah,  Himni,  Omner

nodes.Label: Antionah
nodes.Name: Antionah
nodes.Blurb: Antionah was the chief ruler in the city of Ammonihah. He interacted briefly with Alma on a missionary journey.

nodes.Label: Antipus
nodes.Name: Antipus
nodes.Blurb: Antipus was a Nephite military leader who fought together with Helaman.

nodes.Label: Benjamin
nodes.Name: Benjamin
nodes.Blurb: Benjamin was a righteous king of the Nephites and father to Mosiah. Near the end of his life, Benjamin erected a tower at the temple and called all his people to hear him speak. In this famous discourse, he taught of the plan of salvation and other fundamental doctrines.
nodes.Docs: Angel,  Helaman Son of Benjamin,  Helorum,  Mosiah

nodes.Label: Brother of Jared
nodes.Name: BrotherJared
nodes.Blurb: The Brother of Jared lived at the time of the Tower of Babel. When the Lord confounded the people's language, he led his family and friends across the sea to the new world, where they established a civilization.

nodes.Label: Brothers of Nephi
nodes.Name: BrothersNephi
nodes.Blurb: Laman and Lemuel were two of Lehi's sons, and Nephi's older brothers. They had a difficult time dealing with the hardships associated with leaving their home and traveling in the wilderness for many years. They often antagonized their brothers and father, and upon arrival in the Americas, they and their descendants (later named Lamanites) split from the rest of the family (later called Nephites.)
nodes.Docs: Angel,  Daughters of Ishmael, Godhead,   Ishmael,  Laban,  Lehi,  Nephi,  Sariah,  Sons of Ishmael,  Wife of Ishmael

nodes.Label: Captain Moroni
nodes.Name: CaptainMoroni
nodes.Blurb: Captain Moroni was a righteous man who led the Nephite armies at a time when their nation was being attacked by the Lamanites. Although a bit impetuous, Moroni was able to quell rebellion among the Nephites, as well as successfully defend his land from the Lamanite invaders. He raised the title of liberty to rally his people.
nodes.Docs: Ammoron, Godhead, Helaman, Jacob the Zoramite, Pahoran, Teancum,  Zerahemnah

nodes.Label: Nephihah
nodes.Name: ChiefJudge
nodes.Blurb: Nephihah was the second chief judge of the Nephites. He is described as a righteous man and an elder of the church.
nodes.Docs: Aaron,  Ammon Son of Mosiah,  Himni,  Omner

nodes.Label: Chief Judge in Ammonihah
nodes.Name: ChiefJudgeAmmonihah
nodes.Blurb: The chief judge in Ammonihah was a wicked man who falsely imprisoned and persecuted Alma and Amulek.

nodes.Label: Children of Laman
nodes.Name: ChildrenLaman
nodes.Blurb: Lehi spoke with Laman's children shortly before his death.

nodes.Label: Christ in America
nodes.Name: Christ
nodes.Blurb: After being crucified and resurrected in Jerusalem, Jesus Christ appeared to the people in the Americas. His teachings are recorded in the Book of Mormon.
nodes.Docs: Godhead, Nephi Son of Nephi Son of Helaman,  Three Nephites,  Twelve Disciples

nodes.Label: Corianton
nodes.Name: Corianton
nodes.Blurb: Corianton, Alma's son, forsook the ministry, then repented and returned to preaching. He later sailed to the land northward.

nodes.Label: Coriantumr
nodes.Name: Coriantumr
nodes.Blurb: Coriantumr was a king and the last survivor of the Jaredite nation.

nodes.Label: Daughter of Jared Son of Omer
nodes.Name: DaughterJared
nodes.Blurb: Jared's daughter played a part in a murderous plot to overthrow the king.

nodes.Label: Daughters of Ishmael
nodes.Name: DaughtersIshmael
nodes.Blurb: Ishmael and his family left Jerusalem with Lehi. His daughters married Lehi's sons.

nodes.Label: Enos
nodes.Name: Enos
nodes.Blurb: Enos was the son of Jacob. In his book, he tells of an incident in which he went to hunt in the woods and prayed all day and night for forgiveness of his sins, for his people, and for his enemies. Enos covenanted with the Lord regarding the preservation of the scriptures. He preached to the Lamanites, with little success.

nodes.Label: Ether
nodes.Name: Ether
nodes.Blurb: Ether was a Jaredite prophet who preached repentance to his people.

nodes.Label: Eve
nodes.Name: Eve
nodes.Blurb: Eve was the first woman and progenitor of mankind.

nodes.Label: Father of Lamoni
nodes.Name: FatherLamoni
nodes.Blurb: Lamoni's father was high king over all the Lamanites. After seeing his son's conversion and the bond between his son, Lamoni, and Ammon, he became converted to the Lord. Lamoni's father then enacted laws to provide religious freedom in all the lands of the Lamanites.
nodes.Docs: Aaron,  Ammon Son of Mosiah,  Godhead,  Lamoni

nodes.Label: Gid
nodes.Name: Gid
nodes.Blurb: Gid was a Nephite military leader who fought alongside Helaman.

nodes.Label: Giddianhi
nodes.Name: Giddianhi
nodes.Blurb: Giddianhi was the head of the Gadianton robbers, a wicked organization that dealt in murder, oaths, and treachery. He and his armies attacked the Nephites, but were defeated.

nodes.Label: Giddonah
nodes.Name: Giddonah
nodes.Blurb: Giddonah was the high priest over the land of Gideon at the time of Alma the Younger. He contended with Korihor.

nodes.Label: Gideon
nodes.Name: Gideon
nodes.Blurb: Gideon was a righteous man and Nephite military leader. He spared king Noah's life and helped the people of Limhi escape from bondage. When he was old, he was killed by Nehor for his beliefs.

nodes.Label: Godhead
nodes.Name: Godhead
nodes.Blurb: The Godhead is comprised of God the Father, Jesus Christ, and the Holy Ghost. They spoke to prophets in the Book of Mormon.
nodes.Docs: Aaron,  Abinadi,  Abraham,  Adam,  Ahaz,  Alma,  Alma the Younger,  Ammon Son of Mosiah,  Brother of Jared,  Brothers of Nephi,  Captain Moroni,  Christ in America,  Daughters of Ishmael,  Enos,  Ether,  Father of Lamoni,  Himni,  Isaiah,  Jacob,  Joseph in Egypt,  Lamoni,  Lehi,  Lehi Son of Helaman,  Limhi,  Malachi,  Mormon,  Moroni,  Moses,  Mosiah,  Mosiah Father of Benjamin,  Nephi,  Nephi Son of Helaman,  Nephi Son of Nephi Son of Helaman,  Omer,  Omner,  Samuel the Lamanite,  Sariah,  Servants of Lamoni,  Sons of Ishmael,  Twelve Disciples,  Wife of Ishmael,  Wife of Lamoni,  Zeniff,  Zenock,  Zenos

nodes.Label: Helam
nodes.Name: Helam
nodes.Blurb: Helam was the first person baptized by Alma at the waters of Mormon. The people of Alma named the city of Helam after him.

nodes.Label: Helaman
nodes.Name: Helaman
nodes.Blurb: Helaman, son of Alma the Younger, was a missionary and later military commander. He preached to the Anti-Nephi-Lehies, and led 2,000 of them (sometimes referred to as the stripling warriors) in several Nephite military campaigns.
nodes.Docs: Alma the Younger,  Ammoron,  Antipus, Captain Moroni, Gid,  Stripling Warriors

nodes.Label: Helaman Son of Benjamin
nodes.Name: Helaman3
nodes.Blurb: Helaman was King Benjamin's son and was taught by his father.

nodes.Label: Helaman Son of Helaman
nodes.Name: Helaman2
nodes.Blurb: Helaman was named for his father, Helaman. He was a righteous man. He received the sacred records from Shiblon and served as chief judge of the Nephites for several years.
nodes.Docs: Lehi Son of Helaman,  Nephi Son of Helaman

nodes.Label: Helorum
nodes.Name: Helorum
nodes.Blurb: Helorum was King Benjamin's son and was taught by his father.

nodes.Label: Himni
nodes.Name: Himni
nodes.Blurb: Himni was one of Mosiah's sons. He went with his brothers to preach to the Lamanites.
nodes.Docs: Alma the Younger,  Ammon Son of Mosiah,  Angel,  Anti-Nephi-Lehi,  Chief Judge, Godhead, Mosiah

nodes.Label: Isaiah
nodes.Name: Isaiah
nodes.Blurb: Isaiah was an Old Testament prophet extensively quoted in the Book of Mormon. Lehi's family brought scriptures with them from the old world, and the words of Isaiah were among them.

nodes.Label: Ishmael
nodes.Name: Ishmael
nodes.Blurb: Ishmael and his family left Jerusalem with Lehi. His children and Lehi's children married.

nodes.Label: Jacob
nodes.Name: Jacob
nodes.Blurb: Jacob was Nephi's younger brother. He was significantly younger than Nephi, being born around the time of Nephi's marriage. Jacob was consecrated as a priest and became the leader of the Nephites after Nephi's death.
nodes.Docs: Angel,  Enos, Godhead,  Lehi,  Nephi,  Sherem

nodes.Label: Jacob the Zoramite
nodes.Name: Jacob3
nodes.Blurb: Jacob dissented from the Nephites and led a Lamanite army against them.

nodes.Label: Jared
nodes.Name: Jared
nodes.Blurb: Jared lived at the time of the tower of Babel and crossed to the new world with his family and friends.

nodes.Label: Jared Son of Omer
nodes.Name: Jared2
nodes.Blurb: Jared was an evil Jaredite prince who conspired to kill his father and thereby gain the throne.
nodes.Docs: Akish,  Daughter of Jared Son of Omer

nodes.Label: Jarom
nodes.Name: Jarom
nodes.Blurb: Jarom was Enos's son and Lehi's great-grandson. He wrote the short (15-verse) book of Jarom, before handing the plates to his son, Omni. Jarom was a prophet who had visions and communicated with God.

nodes.Label: Joseph
nodes.Name: Joseph2
nodes.Blurb: Joseph was one of Lehi's younger sons.

nodes.Label: Joseph in Egypt
nodes.Name: Joseph
nodes.Blurb: Joseph was one of the children of Jacob (Israel) in the Old Testament. His story of being sold into slavery and rising to prominence in Egypt is told in Genesis 37-45. He is quoted in the Book of Mormon as the namesake of Joseph, Lehi's youngest son.

nodes.Label: King Laman
nodes.Name: KingLaman
nodes.Blurb: Laman was king over many smaller kingdoms of Lamanites when Zeniff returned to the land of Lehi-Nephi.

nodes.Label: King Noah
nodes.Name: Noah
nodes.Blurb: Noah was a wicked king who departed from his father's righteous ways. He led his people into wickedness and caused the prophet Abinadi to be put to death.
nodes.Docs: Abinadi,  Alma,  Gideon,  Priests of Noah

nodes.Label: King of the Lamanites
nodes.Name: KingLamanites
nodes.Blurb: The King of the Lamanites led his forces against Limhi's people after a misunderstanding.

nodes.Label: Kishkumen
nodes.Name: Kishkumen
nodes.Blurb: Kishkumen led a band of robbers and orchestrated the murder of Pahoran II.

nodes.Label: Korihor
nodes.Name: Korihor
nodes.Blurb: Korihor was an anti-Christ who contended with Alma. After being struck dumb by God, Korihor recognized the error of his ways, but was cast out. He was eventually trampled to death while begging among the Zoramites.

nodes.Label: Laban
nodes.Name: Laban
nodes.Blurb: Laban was a ruler in Jerusalem and the owner of the brass plates (scriptures).

nodes.Label: Lachoneus
nodes.Name: Lachoneus
nodes.Blurb: Lachoneus was the governor of the Nephites at the time of the Gadianton robbers. He helped to establish peace in the land.

nodes.Label: Laman
nodes.Name: Laman
nodes.Blurb: Laman and Lemuel were two of Lehi's sons, and Nephi's older brothers. They had a difficult time dealing with the hardships associated with leaving their home and traveling in the wilderness for many years. They often antagonized their brothers and father, and upon arrival in the Americas, they and their descendants (later named Lamanites) split from the rest of the family (later called Nephites.)
nodes.Docs: Lehi,  Nephi, Sam, Sons of Ishmael

nodes.Label: Lamanite King
nodes.Name: LamaniteKing
nodes.Blurb: The king of the Lamanites at the end of the Book of Mormon oversaw the final battle near the hill Cumorah.

nodes.Label: Lamanite Queen
nodes.Name: LamaniteQueen
nodes.Blurb: Amalickiah killed the king of the Lamanites and through trickery married his wife, the Lamanite queen.

nodes.Label: Lamoni
nodes.Name: Lamoni
nodes.Blurb: Lamoni was a Lamanite king. Ammon came to preach and live among his people. Lamoni was impressed with Ammon's devotion, and was converted to the Lord. Lamoni and Ammon eventually preached to Lamoni's father, who was king over all the land and converted him to the gospel.
nodes.Docs: Ammon Son of Mosiah,  Father of Lamoni,  Godhead,  Servants of Lamoni

nodes.Label: Lehi
nodes.Name: Lehi
nodes.Blurb: Lehi was a prophet who lived at Jerusalem roughly the same time as Jeremiah. Having been warned in a vision that Jerusalem would be destroyed, he took his family, and some of his friends, and fled into the wilderness. After several years, his family built a boat and crossed the ocean to the American continent. Lehi's descendants comprise many of the people in the Book of Mormon.
nodes.Docs: Angel,  Brothers of Nephi,  Children of Laman,  Daughters of Ishmael,  Godhead,  Ishmael,  Jacob,  Joseph2,  Laman,  Lemuel,  Nephi,  Sam,  Sariah,  Sons and Daughters of Lemuel,  Sons of Ishmael,  Wife of Ishmael,  Zoram

nodes.Label: Lehi Son of Helaman
nodes.Name: Lehi2
nodes.Blurb: Lehi and his brother Nephi were missionaries and prophets during the time of the Gadianton robbers. They preached so powerfully that they converted several thousand Lamanites in and around the land of Zarahemla.

nodes.Label: Lehi Son of Zoram
nodes.Name: Lehi3
nodes.Blurb: Lehi was the son of Zoram and a great Nephite military leader.

nodes.Label: Lehonti
nodes.Name: Lehonti
nodes.Blurb: Lehonti, a Lamanite military leader, was led into a trap by Amalickiah and poisoned.

nodes.Label: Lemuel
nodes.Name: Lemuel
nodes.Blurb: Lemuel, together with his brother Laman, persecuted Nephi, eventually breaking from the family to form their own people.

nodes.Label: Limhi
nodes.Name: Limhi
nodes.Blurb: Limhi, son of king Noah, was a righteous king. With the help of Ammon, Limhi and his people escaped from bondage to the Lamanites.
nodes.Docs: Ammon the Mulekite,  Gideon, Godhead,   King of the Lamanites

nodes.Label: Malachi
nodes.Name: Malachi
nodes.Blurb: Malachi was an Old Testament prophet. His words were quoted by Jesus Christ during Christ's visit to the American continent.

nodes.Label: Mormon
nodes.Name: Mormon
nodes.Blurb: Mormon lived hundreds of years after the birth of Christ, when both the Nephites and Lamanites were largely wicked. He was a strong man who led the Nephite armies at the time of their impending destruction. Mormon collected and abridged the Book of Mormon, which is why it bears his name.

nodes.Label: Moroni
nodes.Name: Moroni
nodes.Blurb: Moroni was the son of Mormon. He abridged the record of the Brother of Jared and added it to his father's record. After being present for the final destruction of the Nephites, Moroni wandered in the wilderness for 20 years, hiding from the Lamanites. He eventually hid the record in the earth where it would later be found by Joseph Smith.

nodes.Label: Moses
nodes.Name: Moses
nodes.Blurb: Moses, an Old Testament prophet, led the ancient Hebrews out of Egyptian captivity and into the promised land.

nodes.Label: Mosiah
nodes.Name: Mosiah
nodes.Blurb: Mosiah was a righteous king and the son of Benjamin. Mosiah had the gift of seership, and was able to translate the record of the people of Jared through this gift. Mosiah and Alma the Elder worked closely together for the good of both the Nephites and Lamanites.
nodes.Docs: Aaron, Alma,  Alma the Younger, Ammon Son of Mosiah, Benjamin, Godhead,   Himni,  Omner

nodes.Label: Mosiah Father of Benjamin
nodes.Name: Mosiah2
nodes.Blurb: Mosiah was a Nephite prophet who was made king over the people in Zarahemla.

nodes.Label: Queen of Father of Lamoni
nodes.Name: MotherLamoni
nodes.Blurb: When Lamoni's father fell unconscious, his queen ordered her servants to slay Aaron.

nodes.Label: Nehor
nodes.Name: Nehor
nodes.Blurb: Nehor practiced priestcraft among the Nephites, eventually being executed for the murder of Gideon.

nodes.Label: Nephi
nodes.Name: Nephi
nodes.Blurb: Nephi was the son of Lehi and author of the first two books of the Book of Mormon. He was stalwart in his faith and devotion to the Lord, and became the first leader of the Nephites, named after him.
nodes.Docs: Angel,  Brothers of Nephi,  Daughters of Ishmael, Godhead,   Ishmael,  Jacob,  Laban,  Laman,  Lehi,  Lemuel,  Sam,  Sariah,  Sons of Ishmael,  Zoram

nodes.Label: Nephi Son of Helaman
nodes.Name: Nephi2
nodes.Blurb: Nephi was the son of Helaman, and a Nephite prophet. He was named for Nephi, son of Lehi. Nephi served as chief judge, and later as a missionary. After passing the record to his son, also Nephi, he disappeared from the land shortly before the birth of Christ.

nodes.Label: Nephi Son of Nephi Son of Helaman
nodes.Name: Nephi3
nodes.Blurb: Nephi was a prophet who became one of Christ's disciples.

nodes.Label: Omer
nodes.Name: Omer
nodes.Blurb: Omer, a Jaredite king, was overthrown in a secret combination and subsequently restored to his throne. He later escaped the murderous plot of his son, Jared, and Akish.

nodes.Label: Omner
nodes.Name: Omner
nodes.Blurb: Omner was one of the sons of Mosiah. With his brothers, he preached as a missionary.
nodes.Docs: Alma,  Ammon Son of Mosiah, Angel, Anti-Nephi-Lehi, Chief Judge, Godhead, Mosiah

nodes.Label: Omni
nodes.Name: Omni
nodes.Blurb: Omni, a Nephite, kept the records after Jarom. He expressed regret at not having lived a life in harmony with God's commandments.

nodes.Label: Pahoran
nodes.Name: Pahoran
nodes.Blurb: Pahoran was the chief judge (or governor) of the Nephites during a time of conflict and rebellion. Together with Captain Moroni, Pahoran helped unify his people and repel attacks from the Lamanites. Pahoran was a man of faith and devotion.

nodes.Label: Priests of Noah
nodes.Name: PriestsNoah
nodes.Blurb: King Noah appointed wicked priests who oppressed the people.

nodes.Label: Sam
nodes.Name: Sam
nodes.Blurb: Sam was Nephi's righteous older brother.

nodes.Label: Samuel the Lamanite
nodes.Name: SamuelLamanite
nodes.Blurb: Samuel was a Lamanite prophet who came among the Nephites and prophesied of the impending birth of Jesus Christ in Bethlehem. In his most famous episode, Samuel preached from the city wall. When angry people tried to hit him with stones and arrows, the Lord protected him and Samuel was able to deliver his full message.

nodes.Label: Sariah
nodes.Name: Sariah
nodes.Blurb: Sariah was Lehi's wife and mother to Laman, Lemuel, Nephi, Sam, Jacob, and Joseph.
nodes.Docs: Brothers of Nephi,  Godhead,  Lehi,  Nephi

nodes.Label: Satan
nodes.Name: Satan
nodes.Blurb: Satan, the enemy of all righteousness, is a force for evil who opposes God.

nodes.Label: Servant of Father of Lamoni
nodes.Name: ServantsFatherLamoni
nodes.Blurb: When Lamoni's father fell unconscious, these servants reported the events to the queen.

nodes.Label: Servant of Helaman
nodes.Name: ServantHelaman
nodes.Blurb: Helaman's servant worked to foil Kishkumen's attempt to assassinate Helaman, the chief judge.

nodes.Label: Servant of Lamoni
nodes.Name: ServantLamoni
nodes.Blurb: This servant of Lamoni's told Ammon that the king desired him to stay.

nodes.Label: Servants of Lamoni
nodes.Name: ServantsLamoni
nodes.Blurb: Lamoni's servants tried to protect his flocks from thieves. Ammon miraculously aided them in this enterprise.
nodes.Docs: Ammon Son of Mosiah,  Godhead,  Lamoni

nodes.Label: Sherem
nodes.Name: Sherem
nodes.Blurb: Sherem came among the Nephites at the time of Jacob and taught that there would be no Christ. Jacob contended with him and, at his demand for a sign, asked God to smite him. Sherem was smitten, confessed that he had been deceived by the devil, and died.

nodes.Label: Shiblon
nodes.Name: Shiblon
nodes.Blurb: Shiblon was one of Alma the Younger's sons. He was a faithful missionary alongside his brothers. He took care of the sacred records after his brother, Helaman, died.

nodes.Label: Shiz
nodes.Name: Shiz
nodes.Blurb: Shiz was a Jaredite warlord. His violent conquest ended the Jaredite civilization.

nodes.Label: Sons and Daughters of Lemuel
nodes.Name: ChildrenLemuel
nodes.Blurb: Shortly before dying, Lehi blessed and counseled his grandchildren.

nodes.Label: Sons of Ishmael
nodes.Name: SonsIshmael
nodes.Blurb: The sons of Ishmael joined Lehi and his family on a journey into the wilderness.
nodes.Docs: Brothers of Nephi,  Godhead,  Laman,  Lehi,  Nephi

nodes.Label: Stripling Warriors
nodes.Name: StriplingWarriors
nodes.Blurb: Helaman led 2000 young men into battle to aid the Nephites during a time of war.

nodes.Label: Teancum
nodes.Name: Teancum
nodes.Blurb: Teancum was a great military leader who accomplished several brave missions.

nodes.Label: Three Nephites
nodes.Name: ThreeNephites
nodes.Blurb: Three of Jesus's new-world disciples were promised that they would not taste of death. They traveled through the land preaching and ministering

nodes.Label: Twelve Disciples
nodes.Name: TwelveDisciples
nodes.Blurb: Jesus Christ called these twelve men as his disciples when he visited the new world after his resurrection.

nodes.Label: Wife of Ishmael
nodes.Name: WifeIshmael
nodes.Blurb: Ishmael's wife accompanied her family, journeying to the promised land with Lehi's family.

nodes.Label: Wife of Lamoni
nodes.Name: WifeLamoni
nodes.Blurb: Lamoni's wife was miraculously converted to the gospel, together with her husband.

nodes.Label: Zeezrom
nodes.Name: Zeezrom
nodes.Blurb: Zeezrom, who taught anti-Christian doctrine, was converted by Alma and Amulek and became a powerful missionary.

nodes.Label: Zeniff
nodes.Name: Zeniff
nodes.Blurb: Zeniff was a Nephite who lived during the reign of King Benjamin. He led an expedition to settle in the land of Nephi, which was under Lamanite control. As king, Zeniff advocated for diplomacy over battle, and he and his people lived in uneasy peace with the Lamanites, punctuated by battle. Before his death, he conferred his kingdom on his son, Noah.

nodes.Label: Zenock
nodes.Name: Zenock
nodes.Blurb: Zenock is assumed to be an old-world prophet. His words are not found in the Bible, though they were presumably on the brass plates.

nodes.Label: Zenos
nodes.Name: Zenos
nodes.Blurb: Zenos was an old-world prophet whose words were written on the plates of brass. His allegory of the olive tree is recorded in Jacob chapter 5.

nodes.Label: Zerahemnah
nodes.Name: Zerahemnah
nodes.Blurb: Zerahemnah, a Lamanite military leader, contended against Captain Moroni. He declined to make a covenant not to attack again, knowing his people would not keep it. He was scalped, defeated, and finally, agreed to make the covenant.

nodes.Label: Zoram
nodes.Name: Zoram
nodes.Blurb: Zoram kept Laban's records. He left Jerusalem with Lehi's family.

nodes.Label: Zoram Captain of Nephites
nodes.Name: Zoram2
nodes.Blurb: Zoram was a Nephite military leader who sought counsel from Alma the Younger, high priest over the Church.

Now Zerahemnah, when he saw that they were all about to be destroyed, cried mightily unto Moroni, promising that he would covenant and also his people with them, if they would spare the remainder of their lives, that they never would come to war again against them.
